snippet: The Supreme Court’s hearing of two cases on gay marriage could result in a split decision that would provide benefits to couples in some states, but permit other states to forbid same-sex marriages.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column suggests that the Supreme Court’s speedy decision to hear two cases on gay marriage, which could afford the chance for the court to issue a sweeping ruling that would cast aside bans on same-sex marriage nationwide, could also result in a split decision providing benefits to couples in some states, while allowing other states to forbid same-sex marriages.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s hearing of two cases on gay marriage could result in a split decision that would provide benefits to couples in some states, but permit other states to forbid same-sex marriages.

headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Issue Pushes Justices Into Overdrive
headline.seo: Court Enters Same-Sex Fray With Uncharacteristic Speed
headline.main: Same-Sex Issue Pushes Justices Into Overdrive

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
